text:
(1)
Richmond Road, north side, west of Spruce Street, showing the "Golden Rectory", the former rectory of St. Andrews Protestant Episcopal Church, built by Dr. David Moore in 1818. See "History-Story-Legend of the Old Kings Highway by the Staten Island Antiquarian Society, p.18.
P. L. Sperr
Spring, 1925

(2)
The same, at a later date.
P. L. Sperr
May, 1927

(3)
An additional view.
P. L. Sperr
May, 1927

(1) Richmond Road, north side, west of Spruce Street, showing the barn of the "Golden Rectory," former rectory of St. Andrews Protestant Episcopal Church.
May, 1927
P.L. Sperr

(2) Looking north across the fence of the "Golden Rectory." In the background appears the Ambrose Channel Lighthouse.
April 30, 1929
P.L. Sperr

(3) The same as view 2. Shown are apple blossoms in bloom.
April 30, 1929
P.L. Sperr
